alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 8:45PM CDT until June 11 at 7:27PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...From late tonight to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins, agricultural lands along the river begin to flood. At 22.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river are flooded. Portions of Corinth Road, north of Danville, become flooded. At 24.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins, county roads and bridges begin to flood. Bailey Branch Road, State Highway 80 southwest of Danville, and State Highway 27 north of Danville may be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight (Wednesday June 8) and continue to rise to a crest of 23.3 feet by early Friday morning (June 10). - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 18.5 Wed 7 PM 23.2 16.2 12.2 23.3 1 AM 6/10 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
